courses.description:
Software Quality Assurance Engineer: 

Software test engineer is one of the most demandable positions in the software development team. Part of the responsibilities is to understand business requirements, work in an agile scrum environment, prepare test cases, test execution, bug creation, identify test automation, provide product release and verification, and become an expert on the application and services to be qualified as a Subject matter expert. All of these you can learn and gain hands-on experience from the TS4U.


Why TS4U and trust us to become a Cloud Software Test Automation Engineer:


  1. "So, Let's highlight some of the areas where you will be one of the experts and gain professional experience and hands-on skills."
  2. "Learn, implement, and become an End2End expert in the following areas:"
  3. Quality Analyst and Quality Engineer to follow Agile scrum throughout the program
  4. Software Development Life cycle on e-commerce and SaaS-based platform
  5. Manual Testing for e-commerce and SaaS-based platforms.
  6. Core Java to develop a test automation framework for e-Commerce web applications using Selenium Web Driver
  7. Core JavaScript to develop a test automation framework for e-commerce web applications using Cypress
  8. Develop a test automation framework from scratch
  9. Gain the ability to work on an existing framework.
  10. Mobile app testing and API Test Automation framework
  11. Cucumber framework
  12. Version control using GitHub on the e-commerce platform.
  13. Generate reporting and run automation through the CI/CD pipeline.
  14. Release management process, and Learn Linux on the Cloud platform


A high level of how you learn and become a software Test Automation engineer through TS4U?


  1. Complete Weekly technical tests and task
  2. Provide presentation and mentoring throughout the journey
  3. Pass quarterly technical tests and task

Software Quality Assurance Engineer is the role of a Software Development team, and the responsibilities of a Software Quality Assurance Engineer are to understand the project, and requirements of the project, analyze the requirements and do testing through the lifecycle of the project. 


In this life cycle, the quality engineer works in an Agile Scrum environment and completes the functional and non-functional testing which are precise to the business requirements. So it can be Manual Testing and Automation Testing, so here‚Äôs why you should choose us:


  • Our program provides a platform for our members with IT backgrounds or non-IT backgrounds.
  • We teach our members each of the required technology that will ensure to become successful as Software Quality Assurance Engineers.
  • We also provide them with a corporate environment where they can learn, grow, make mistakes and learn from their mistakes.
  • We provide them with TS4U‚Äôs own developed software and cloud natives development environment so that they can understand the requirements from scratch and perform the testing throughout their program lifecycle.
  • Our program is eight-month-long or more so that a member can understand a project and our members can also repeat the program without further payments.
  • A project can be six to eight months or longer.
  • We teach Agile Scrum and the whole Software Development Lifecycle and provide them with the development environment.
  • For the project management tools, we teach Jira and Microsoft Azure DevOps and we also adopt Agile Scrum for the development methodology.


Agile Scrum and Project Management Tools:

 

We follow the Sprint board, and backlog, inside the backlog, there are Epics, Features, User Stories, Tasks, Bugs, Sprint velocity, Sprint start time, Sprint end time, Daily Stand Up, Retrospective Board, and the different types of review meetings like test case review meeting and technical review meeting with the developer.


Manual Testing and Communication:


Members learn the test cases from the templates given in a project, they learn how to do the Daily Stand Up and they learn the different technologies and communication tools such as:

  • Microsoft Outlook for Email communication 
  • Slack for Interactive communication 
  • Zoom for Online meetings.


Understand Swagger and do the API Testing:


We also teach them what is the RESTful API and we also provide them access permission to our APIs. 


  • We teach them swagger for the API specification, which is a complete API specification web-based tool
  • They learn the APIs specification from Swagger based on the user story
  • This is how they can understand, how an API works, what is the payload of the API, what type of API method it is, and what the HTTP code represents!


Postman as API Testing Tool, DB Query, and Linux OS:


  • We teach them the whole Postman RESTful client testing tool, they learn the different functionality of the postman, and they also learn the API automation throughout using the Postman.
  • We also teach them the Database Query because they can verify the API test result of the web test result on the database with the help of queries.
  • We give them access permission to the database. We also teach them and let them do hands-on practice on Linux because our application is deployed on Linux and instead of Linux
  • We actually use Linux on the cloud. So they get access to the cloud and get to learn what is the cloud computing, benefits of the cloud computing and how to create a Linux server on the cloud.


Core Java:


  • For the deep dive into Automation, we teach our members Core Java for the Software Automation Engineer
  • We use Java for creating projects, classes, objects, methods, different data types, inheritance, polymorphism, constructors, and the different types of strings.
  • We also teach some logical programming language basics like the if-else statement, for loop


  • We provide them with all the necessary knowledge for Core Java so that they can do the GUI automation.


Selenium Web Driver:


For the GUI automation, firstly we teach our members, What is the web element? How does the web element work? We provide our own developed Web Application. So our members can get familiar with the web element, and they can create the automation script using Core Java, Eclipse IDE, and IntelliJ, once they understand Core Java and Eclipse IDE. We use the Web Elements for Web Automation, and we start designing our Web Automation Framework.


  • So in the framework, we actually design the page in the Maven project
  • We teach our members how to add all the dependencies
  • We teach our members The BDD framework (behavioral driven framework), framework design, the page object model, the features file, step definition, and hooks file.
  • We build the test case scenario, and we add all the Page Object Models that have and all the web elements based on the test case scenarios 
  • For the TestNG, we teach our members the designing of all the test scenarios which are based on the business requirements and run them.
  • We teach them how to divide them and finally, we take the code to GitHub for the code repository.
  • Our members can learn the GitHub push, pull, create a repository, update repository, clone a repository, and all these basic functionalities of GitHub.
  • Finally, our members are able to learn and run their automation script on the Jenkins as part of the CI-CD.
  • So the script can be kicked up before the new code release or after the new code release, as well as identify new bugs. 



Why us?

  • ‚Äã‚ÄãWe provide technical ability to communicate, understand, and understand the collaboration, importance of collaboration.
  • We provide our members feedback on their writing and communication skills
  • We teach our members how to write in the official corporate English language so they can communicate and explain their work.
  • We also have the weekly presentation which we call the ‚ÄúShow and Tell‚Äù and it enables our members to explain and present what they have learned throughout the week.
  • We encourage our members to have a group and build group communication skills and provide daily stand-up every day.


  • We'll also provide them with the program roadmap to ensure they are transformed into successful Software Quality Assurance Engineers.


ÔªøOffered Tools and Technology

Manual and Software Development: Agile Scrum, DevOps Azure, JIRA, Swagger, Project Life Cycle, User Story Life Cycle, Bug Life Cycle, Test Case Development, Test Scenarios Development, Database Query, Linux Basic, GitHub For Code Repo, Jenkins for CICD, NodeJs, Newman, Mock Interview.

Programming Language: Java Class, Method, Variable, Objects, Datatypes, Constructor, If Else Statement, Java Modifiers, Inheritance, Array, Try and Catch, Loops, Comments, ArrayList, Math, Polymorphism, String Length, Operators, Type Casting, Method Overloading, Keywords, Enum, Interface, Abstract, Create Folder Class for POM.

Web Automation: Selenium WebDriver, Maven, POM, BDD, HOOKS, Step Definition, Feature File, Allure Test Report, RESTAssured

courses.description:
Become an AWS CloudOps Engineer without any prior IT skills. We have designed from the 0 and bring you up to the ready in large companies in the USA. Our courses are designed based on today's and future tools and technology.

Why TS4U and trust us to become an AWS CloudOps Engineer:

"So, Let's highlight some of the areas where you will be one of the experts and gain professional experience and hands-on skills."

  1. DevOps and AWS CloudOps Engineer to follow Agile scrum throughout the program

  4. Deploy manual and automation of multiple stacks (Such as LAMP, M-E-RN stands for Mongo, Express, React, and NodeJS stack, Monolithic, Microservices, JAVA, NodeJS, Go, and others on AWS cloud.
  5. Production issue and release management

A high level of how you learn and become an AWS CloudOps Engineer through TS4U?

  1. Complete Weekly technical tests and task

Please join our chat at https://ts4u.us/link/training for FREE personal career counseling, scholarship, and discounts!

What is CloudOps Engineer

CloudOps Engineers are experts in developing and deploying cloud-based applications such as SaaS and PaaS. Cloud Operation Engineer Responsibility usually operates in an office environment and is employed by technology services and software businesses. Cloud Operation Engineer may collaborate with departments such as application development and risk management to help with the early stages of development. 


Additionally, Cloud Operation Engineer Responsibility may involve developing and implementing disaster recovery solutions, as well as helping with continuous improvement efforts. These experts may supervise system monitoring solutions and provide technical support to field workers. Chief CloudOps Engineer may develop methods for assessing the efficacy of their systems and identifying areas for improvement. 


Cloud Operation Engineer's Responsibility is to develop procedures to ensure the security of the environment, as well as automated processes to give information on current requirements. Cloud Operations Engineers should remain current on emerging technologies and provide suggestions to organizational management about new solutions. 


CloudOps Engineer tasks include being in charge of tool selection, as well as compliance checks and reporting. Cloud Operation Engineer will be in charge of discovering, fixing, and improving critical software tools. Additionally, Chief CloudOps Engineer may look for methods to improve system operations, with an emphasis on automation and cost reduction. 

Cloud operations (CloudOps) is the process of managing, delivering, and consuming software in a computer environment with limited visibility into the underlying infrastructure of an application. 


CloudOps in the enterprise leverages DevOps principles of continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) to establish best practices for ensuring high availability via the refinement and optimization of business processes running in a public cloud. 


Typically, a CloudOps team's duties include the following: 

  • Configuration 
  • Administration
  • Allotment of resources
  • maximizing capacity for performance
  • minimizing compliance costs, and guaranteeing compliance with service-level agreements (SLAs). 


Cloud Operation Engineers begin their careers in the automotive industry, working for companies such as GM, Ford, Toyota, Chrysler, and others. Additionally, CloudOps Engineer job placement and Careers in Google, Facebook, Amazon, and Yandex are available in addition to the theoretical and practical work training. Microsoft, Wikipedia, and Yahoo are just a few examples.


Training and Transformation for CloudOps Engineer

Companies are increasingly relying on CloudOps Engineers to evaluate their infrastructure and migrate various operations to a cloud-based system, as more and more important business processes and applications are being moved to public, private, and hybrid cloud infrastructures. 

A combination of technical abilities and business expertise is required for this position. Cloud Operation Engineer must have worked with at least one of the major cloud providers, including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform. 

The IT infrastructure is always evolving. The first computers, which took up a whole room, were controlled by technicians in the early days of computing. Over time, specialized equipment began to occupy the racks of data centers, which were then arranged in long rows on elevated floors. There is less interest in the underlying hardware and more emphasis is given to the overlying software capabilities when it comes to cloud computing technology. 

Given the increasing need for cloud computing talents in today's market, it is beneficial to understand the specific skills required of a Cloud Engineer Jobs

  • Linux- Although the cloud is a collection of virtualized, software-defined IT services that have been separated from their underlying hardware, it still needs an operating system to operate properly and efficiently. And Linux is the operating system of choice for the majority of users.
  • Programming- Cloud Operation Engineers that operate in the cloud computing environment have a variety of responsibilities. Cloud Operation Engineer Responsibilities in the fields of development, systems support, networking, security, and design. The ability to create scripts and deal with code is particularly important for developers, but there are many possibilities for cloud engineers of all colors to write scripts and deal with code.
  • Database Management- Databases, like so many other IT functional areas, are quickly migrating to the cloud. Unlike conventional databases, which are housed in data centers and maintained in discrete geographic areas, cloud databases may be distributed across a cloud architecture. Database-as-a-Service (DBaaS) is a kind of cloud database service provided by cloud providers for the purpose of storing and managing client data. As a cloud engineer, Chief CloudOps Engineer needs database abilities that extend beyond those required in the data center. NetApp discusses the typical database issues in the cloud in an essay. These include storage capacity constraints, database cloning, and multi-load operations. Although SQL is the primary database language for cloud computing, NoSQL is gaining popularity as a viable alternative to SQL's strict structure.
  • Multi-Cloud Deployment- Managing and deploying a single cloud is tough enough but managing a multi-cloud system may be much more complicated. The trick is to figure out how to integrate all the different cloud services into a single management system. In an ideal world, a Cloud Operation Engineer would have a single pane of glass for centralized management of the organization's public and private clouds.
  • Artificial Intelligence & Machine learning- A significant portion of the cloud is being developed using self-contained apps. For example, chatbots and virtual assistants rapidly analyze and understand user input in order to react to queries and requests. Business intelligence and intelligent IoT devices are only two components of the complex web of networks that cloud developers must manage. Any Cloud Operation Engineer interested in working on the cloud will need to have a basic understanding of artificial intelligence and associated technologies. Cognitive computing is enabled by machine learning algorithms, which allow it to generate insights from massive amounts of data. While managing the cloud does not need a data scientist, it never hurts to brush up on your knowledge of AI and machine learning.
  • Automation- The information technology sector is constantly churning new buzzwords whose meanings may stay obscure for many years. Cloud automation is one of them. Automation is all about control and decision-making led by Chief CloudOps Engineer. CloudOps Engineer Jobs is to automate a computer process by allowing one piece of software to choose the next action in response to another. Cloud orchestration is similar to cloud automation, except that it automates many activities rather than a single one. Orchestration orchestrates the way cloud components accomplish tasks by coordinating activities and ensuring that everything works in unison ‚Äì similar to an orchestra. Today's cloud infrastructures are heavily automated.
  • Cloud Security- Clearly, any information technology system that is linked to the internet needs strong security. Because the dangerous surface is so large, the cloud is especially susceptible to assault. Datacenter security may be maintained by enforcing firewalls and intrusion detection systems on external connections. However, maintaining security in today's dispersed computer environment, dubbed the cloud, is much more challenging.
  • Adaptability- Of course, this is not a specific talent reserved for Chief Cloud Ops Engineer. However, it is arguably the most critical talent that everyone should possess. It is critical to acquire knowledge of networking protocols, operating systems, web technologies, and cloud computing platforms. However, none of the skills you've acquired via books, videos, or classroom training will assist you if you lack the ability to think on your feet. The Cloud Operation Engineer's Responsibilities include constant adaptation to new technologies and, at times, creating solutions on the fly. That is the only way to ensure a lengthy career in information technology.


By obtaining these certifications, Cloud Operation Engineers may gain jobs in the automobile sector, working for firms such as GM, Ford, Toyota, and Chrysler. Additionally, in addition to theoretical and practical job training, CloudOps Engineers may develop their careers with Google, Facebook, Amazon, and Yandex. Microsoft, Wikipedia, and Yahoo are just a few examples.

courses.description:
What is a Full Stack Developer?

Full Stack Developer is an engineer who works on both the client-side and server-side of the software application. This type of developer works on the Full Stack of a software application meaning Front end development, Back end development, Database, Server, API, and version controlling systems. Hence, the name ‚ÄúFull Stack‚Äù Developer.

Full-stack developer translates user requirements into the overall architecture and implements the new systems. A Full-Stack Developer doesn‚Äôt necessarily master all technologies. However, the professional is expected to work on the client as well as server sides and understand what is going on when developing an application. He or she should have a genuine interest in all software technologies.


Why Do You Need a Full-Stack Developer?

Here are some prominent reasons why you should hire a full-stack development professional:

  • A full-stack developer helps you to keep every part of the system running smoothly
  • Full-stack developers can provide help to everyone in the team and greatly reduce the time and technical costs of team communication
  • If one person plays different roles, it saves your company‚Äôs personnel, infrastructure, and operational cost


MERN Stack

MERN is a collection of JavaScript-based technologies:

  • M=MongoDB: Popular NoSQL database
  • E=Express: Light and portable web program framework
  • R=React: A javascript library for building user interfaces
  • N=Node.js: A server-side JavaScript run time

This stack is currently in huge demand as it is widely used to develop web applications.


What is a Software Stack? Which Stack Should I Learn?

A software stack is a collection of the programs which are used together to produce a specific result. It includes an operating system and its application. For example, a smartphone software stack includes OS along with the phone app, web browsers, and default applications.

The above list of skill sets for a full-stack engineer could be daunting. You need to master a software stack based on your career goals, project, and company requirement. Following is a list of popular software stacks.

Irrespective of the stack you choose, you will find similarities in the architecture and design patterns across different stacks.


Full Stack Developer Skill Set

1) Front-end technology

Full-stack developers should be masters of essential front-end technologies like HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. Knowledge of third-party libraries like ReactJS is desirable and prepared in the program

2) Development Languages

The full-stack engineers should know at least one server-side programming language like Java, Python, Ruby, .Net, etc. JavaScript is the main program language for this program based on the MERN stack.

3) Database and cache

Knowledge of various DBMS technology is another important need of a full-stack developer. MySQL, MongoDB, Oracle, and SQLServer are widely used for this purpose. Knowledge of caching mechanisms like varnish, Memcached, and Redis is a plus. MongoDB is the part of the stack throughout the program.

4) Basic design ability

In order to become a successful Full-Stack web developer, knowledge of designing is also recommended. Moreover, the person should know the principle of basic prototype design and UI /UX design.

5) Server

Exposure to handling Apache or Nginx servers is desirable. A good background in Linux helps tremendously in administering servers.

6) Version control system (VCS)

A version control system allows full-stack developers to keep track of all the changes made in the codebase. The knowledge of Git helps full stack developers to understand how to get the latest code, update parts of the code, and make changes in other developers‚Äô code without breaking things.

7) Working with API (REST & SOAP):

Knowledge of web services or APIs is also important for full-stack developers. Knowledge of the creation and consumption of REST and SOAP services is desirable.

Other Pieces of the Puzzle:

  1. Ability to write quality unit tests
  2. He or she should have a complete understanding of automated processes for building testing, documenting, and deploying it at scale
  3. An awareness of security concerns is important, as each layer has its own vulnerabilities
  4. Knowledge of Algorithms and data structures is also an essential need for professional full-stack developers

What is a Python Software Engineer?

As a Python engineer, your job is to use the Python programming language and develop code for your company. Your duties include creating a new application, integrating Python software with an existing system, or testing existing code to iron out bugs. Most employers hiring for this role have specific goals for projects in mind, and it is your job to turn those goals into reality in the most effective way. You‚Äôre also expected to use other programming skills, particularly involving Django, JavaScript, and database architecture.


How to become a Python Software Engineer? From a Famous Job Search Site:

The primary requirements to become a Python engineer include a bachelor's degree in a field such as computer science or engineering and a robust working knowledge of Python as a programming language. Employers often have specific requirements based on their individual needs, such as familiarity with other programming languages or experience in the field. Helpful areas to have expertise in include working with SQL, administering Windows or Linux, and using relational data. This position requires that you work well with many other departments in a company, so employers also value interpersonal skills.


Generic Roles and Responsibilities as Python Software Engineer? From a Famous Site:

  1. A Python Developer is responsible for the coding, designing, deploying, and debugging of development projects, typically on the server-side (or back-end). They may, however, also help organizations with their technological framework.
  2. A Python Developer‚Äôs role can span a wide variety of duties. You might be asked to create an application for your employer, design the framework for your code, build tools as necessary to get the job done, create websites, or publish new services. A Python Developer often works in close collaboration with data collection and analytics to create useful answers to questions and provide valuable insight.
  3. Like most programming positions, the specifics of this job vary based on the needs of your employer. Some Python Developers work as independent contractors instead of being exclusive to one company.
  4. Python is being used in web development, machine learning, AI, scientific computing, and academic research. Its popularity can be credited with the growing data science community embracing artificial intelligence and machine learning. Industries like education, healthcare, and finance are using machine-learning applications to innovate their organizations.
  5. Python is also widely used by companies including Netflix, Google, Facebook, Reddit, YouTube, Instagram, and more. Specifically, Spotify uses Python within its back-end services, capturing user data to provide accurate recommendations and playlists. Dropbox, meanwhile, uses Python scripts to create its native applications on each platform (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android, etc.)
  6. A Python Developer will likely also be responsible for creating integrable systems, but ultimately, the role depends on the industry and job description.

courses.description:
What is a Frontend Developer?

Full Stack Developer is an engineer who works on both the client-side and server-side of the software application. This type of developer works on the Full Stack of a software application meaning Front end development, Back end development, Database, Server, API, and version controlling systems. Hence, the name ‚ÄúFull Stack‚Äù Developer.

Full-stack developer translates user requirements into the overall architecture and implements the new systems. A Full-Stack Developer doesn‚Äôt necessarily master all technologies. However, the professional is expected to work on the client as well as server sides and understand what is going on when developing an application. He or she should have a genuine interest in all software technologies.


Why Do You Need a Full-Stack Developer?

Here are some prominent reasons why you should hire a full-stack development professional:

  • A full-stack developer helps you to keep every part of the system running smoothly
  • Full-stack developers can provide help to everyone in the team and greatly reduce the time and technical costs of team communication
  • If one person plays different roles, it saves your company‚Äôs personnel, infrastructure, and operational cost


MERN Stack

MERN is a collection of JavaScript-based technologies:

  • M=MongoDB: Popular NoSQL database
  • E=Express: Light and portable web program framework
  • R=React: A javascript library for building user interfaces
  • N=Node.js: A server-side JavaScript run time

This stack is currently in huge demand as it is widely used to develop web applications.


What is a Software Stack? Which Stack Should I Learn?

A software stack is a collection of the programs which are used together to produce a specific result. It includes an operating system and its application. For example, a smartphone software stack includes OS along with the phone app, web browsers, and default applications.

The above list of skill sets for a full-stack engineer could be daunting. You need to master a software stack based on your career goals, project, and company requirement. Following is a list of popular software stacks.

Irrespective of the stack you choose, you will find similarities in the architecture and design patterns across different stacks.


Full Stack Developer Skill Set

1) Front-end technology

Full-stack developers should be masters of essential front-end technologies like HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. Knowledge of third-party libraries like ReactJS is desirable and prepared in the program

2) Development Languages

The full-stack engineers should know at least one server-side programming language like Java, Python, Ruby, .Net, etc. JavaScript is the main program language for this program based on the MERN stack.

3) Database and cache

Knowledge of various DBMS technology is another important need of a full-stack developer. MySQL, MongoDB, Oracle, and SQLServer are widely used for this purpose. Knowledge of caching mechanisms like varnish, Memcached, and Redis is a plus. MongoDB is part of the stack throughout the program.

4) Basic design ability

In order to become a successful Full-Stack web developer, knowledge of designing is also recommended. Moreover, the person should know the principle of basic prototype design and UI /UX design.

5) Server

Exposure to handling Apache or Nginx servers is desirable. A good background in Linux helps tremendously in administering servers.

6) Version control system (VCS)

A version control system allows full-stack developers to keep track of all the changes made in the codebase. The knowledge of Git helps full stack developers to understand how to get the latest code, update parts of the code, and make changes in other developers‚Äô code without breaking things.

7) Working with API (REST & SOAP):

Knowledge of web services or APIs is also important for full-stack developers. Knowledge of the creation and consumption of REST and SOAP services is desirable.

Other Pieces of the Puzzle:

  1. Ability to write quality unit tests
  2. He or she should have a complete understanding of automated processes for building, testing, documenting, and deploying it at scale.
  3. An awareness of security concerns is important, as each layer has its own vulnerabilities.
  4. Knowledge of Algorithms and data structures is also an essential need for professional full-stack developers.

courses.description:
Software Quality Assurance Engineer: 

Software test engineer is one of the most demandable positions in the software development team. Part of the responsibilities is to understand business requirements, work in an agile scrum environment, prepare test cases, test execution, bug creation, identify test automation, provide product release and verification, and become an expert on the application and services to be qualified as a Subject matter expert. All of these you can learn and gain hands-on experience from the TS4U.


Why TS4U and trust us to become a Cloud Software Test Automation Engineer:


  1. "So, Let's highlight some of the areas where you will be one of the experts and gain professional experience and hands-on skills."
  2. "Learn, implement, and become an End2End expert in the following areas:"
  3. Quality Analyst and Quality Engineer to follow Agile scrum throughout the program
  4. Software Development Life cycle on e-commerce and SaaS-based platform
  5. Manual Testing for e-commerce and SaaS-based platforms.
  6. Core Java to develop a test automation framework for e-Commerce web applications using Selenium Web Driver
  7. Core JavaScript to develop a test automation framework for e-commerce web applications using Cypress
  8. Develop a test automation framework from scratch
  9. Gain the ability to work on an existing framework.
  10. Mobile app testing and API Test Automation framework
  11. Cucumber framework
  12. Version control using GitHub on the e-commerce platform.
  13. Generate reporting and run automation through the CI/CD pipeline.
  14. Release management process, and Learn Linux on the Cloud platform


A high level of how you learn and become a software Test Automation engineer through TS4U?


  1. Complete Weekly technical tests and task
  2. Provide presentation and mentoring throughout the journey
  3. Pass quarterly technical tests and task
  4. Gain problem-solving skills and expertise
  5. Complete automated mock interviews
  6. Interview prep, job exploration, and negotiation
  7. Accept the offer letter, pass background, and join the job
  8. Receive professional job assistance

Please join our chat for FREE personal career counseling, scholarship, and discounts!


Software Quality Assurance Engineer is the role of a Software Development team, and the responsibilities of a Software Quality Assurance Engineer are to understand the project, and requirements of the project, analyze the requirements and do testing through the lifecycle of the project. 


In this life cycle, the quality engineer works in an Agile Scrum environment and completes the functional and non-functional testing which are precise to the business requirements. So it can be Manual Testing and Automation Testing, so here‚Äôs why you should choose us:


  • Our program provides a platform for our members with IT backgrounds or non-IT backgrounds.
  • We teach our members each of the required technology that will ensure to become successful as Software Quality Assurance Engineers.
  • We also provide them with a corporate environment where they can learn, grow, make mistakes and learn from their mistakes.
  • We provide them with TS4U‚Äôs own developed software and cloud natives development environment so that they can understand the requirements from scratch and perform the testing throughout their program lifecycle.
  • Our program is eight-month-long or more so that a member can understand a project and our members can also repeat the program without further payments.
  • A project can be six to eight months or longer.
  • We teach Agile Scrum and the whole Software Development Lifecycle and provide them with the development environment.
  • For the project management tools, we teach Jira and Microsoft Azure DevOps and we also adopt Agile Scrum for the development methodology.


Agile Scrum and Project Management Tools:

 

We follow the Sprint board, and backlog, inside the backlog, there are Epics, Features, User Stories, Tasks, Bugs, Sprint velocity, Sprint start time, Sprint end time, Daily Stand Up, Retrospective Board, and the different types of review meetings like test case review meeting and technical review meeting with the developer.


Manual Testing and Communication:


Members learn the test cases from the templates given in a project, they learn how to do the Daily Stand Up and they learn the different technologies and communication tools such as:

  • Microsoft Outlook for Email communication 
  • Slack for Interactive communication 
  • Zoom for Online meetings.


Understand Swagger and do the API Testing:


We also teach them what is the RESTful API and we also provide them access permission to our APIs. 


  • We teach them swagger for the API specification, which is a complete API specification web-based tool
  • They learn the APIs specification from Swagger based on the user story
  • This is how they can understand, how an API works, what is the payload of the API, what type of API method it is, and what the HTTP code represents!


Postman as API Testing Tool, DB Query, and Linux OS:


  • We teach them the whole Postman RESTful client testing tool, they learn the different functionality of the postman, and they also learn the API automation throughout using the Postman.
  • We also teach them the Database Query because they can verify the API test result of the web test result on the database with the help of queries.
  • We give them access permission to the database. We also teach them and let them do hands-on practice on Linux because our application is deployed on Linux and instead of Linux
  • We actually use Linux on the cloud. So they get access to the cloud and get to learn what is the cloud computing, benefits of the cloud computing and how to create a Linux server on the cloud.


Core Java:


  • For the deep dive into Automation, we teach our members Core Java for the Software Automation Engineer
  • We use Java for creating projects, classes, objects, methods, different data types, inheritance, polymorphism, constructors, and the different types of strings.
  • We also teach some logical programming language basics like the if-else statement, for loop


  • We provide them with all the necessary knowledge for Core Java so that they can do the GUI automation.


Selenium Web Driver:


For the GUI automation, firstly we teach our members, What is the web element? How does the web element work? We provide our own developed Web Application. So our members can get familiar with the web element, and they can create the automation script using Core Java, Eclipse IDE, and IntelliJ, once they understand Core Java and Eclipse IDE. We use the Web Elements for Web Automation, and we start designing our Web Automation Framework.


  • So in the framework, we actually design the page in the Maven project
  • We teach our members how to add all the dependencies
  • We teach our members The BDD framework (behavioral driven framework), framework design, the page object model, the features file, step definition, and hooks file.
  • We build the test case scenario, and we add all the Page Object Models that have and all the web elements based on the test case scenarios 
  • For the TestNG, we teach our members the designing of all the test scenarios which are based on the business requirements and run them.
  • We teach them how to divide them and finally, we take the code to GitHub for the code repository.
  • Our members can learn the GitHub push, pull, create a repository, update repository, clone a repository, and all these basic functionalities of GitHub.
  • Finally, our members are able to learn and run their automation script on the Jenkins as part of the CI-CD.
  • So the script can be kicked up before the new code release or after the new code release, as well as identify new bugs. 



Why us?

  • ‚Äã‚ÄãWe provide technical ability to communicate, understand, and understand the collaboration, importance of collaboration.
  • We provide our members feedback on their writing and communication skills
  • We teach our members how to write in the official corporate English language so they can communicate and explain their work.
  • We also have the weekly presentation which we call the ‚ÄúShow and Tell‚Äù and it enables our members to explain and present what they have learned throughout the week.
  • We encourage our members to have a group and build group communication skills and provide daily stand-up every day.


  • We'll also provide them with the program roadmap to ensure they are transformed into successful Software Quality Assurance Engineers.


ÔªøOffered Tools and Technology

Manual and Software Development: Agile Scrum, DevOps Azure, JIRA, Swagger, Project Life Cycle, User Story Life Cycle, Bug Life Cycle, Test Case Development, Test Scenarios Development, Database Query, Linux Basic, GitHub For Code Repo, Jenkins for CICD, NodeJs, Newman, Mock Interview.

Programming Language: Java Class, Method, Variable, Objects, Datatypes, Constructor, If Else Statement, Java Modifiers, Inheritance, Array, Try and Catch, Loops, Comments, ArrayList, Math, Polymorphism, String Length, Operators, Type Casting, Method Overloading, Keywords, Enum, Interface, Abstract, Create Folder Class for POM.

Web Automation: Selenium WebDriver, Maven, POM, BDD, HOOKS, Step Definition, Feature File, Allure Test Report, RESTAssured
